column3: Cardiff School of Law and Politics
column5: Why study this courseGain a thorough understanding of International Relations and be taught by leading researchers in the field.Our MSc Econ International Relations programme bridges the subfields of international relations theory, international security, political science and philosophy, international law, foreign policy analysis, diplomacy, international history and international political economy.This programme provides a structure for the advanced study of an exciting disciplinary field. Specialist optional modules address a range of contemporary global concerns such as environmental politics, feminism, digital technologies and conflict management.
column9: 1 year full time, 2 years part time
